item.title: Plotting a Normal Curve
item.description: Plotting a Normal Curve from scipy.stats import norm import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np import seaborn as sns %matplotlib inline A full normal curve cannot be plotted because it ranges from -inf to inf. We’ll plot a curve which covers 98% of the density. A normal(univariate) curve is defined by two parameters, mean and sigma. We find ppf(0.01) and ppf(0.99) then generate equallt spaced points between those. The percent point function (ppf) is the inverse of the cumulative distribution function.
